snippet: As an exhibition of Al Hirschfeld’s works opens at the New York Public Library for the Performing Arts, four performers talk about how they felt about being drawn by that illustrator.
abstract: Broadway performers Michael Feinstein, Carol Channing, Alan Cumming and Tommy Tune talk about how they felt about being drawn by illustrator Al Hirschfeld, whose works are being exhibited at New York Public Library for the Performing Arts.
lead_paragraph: As an exhibition of Al Hirschfeld’s works opens at the New York Public Library for the Performing Arts, four performers talk about how they felt about being drawn by that illustrator.

headline.seo: ‘The Line King’s Library’ Shows Al Hirschfeld’s Works
headline.main: How It Felt to Be Caught in the Act
headline.print_headline: How It Felt to Be Caught in the Act

keywords.value: New York Public Library for the Performing Arts
